summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ OIG Special Agents with a BOP correctional lieutenant (SIS Lieutenant) regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019. The interview covers the July 23, 2019 suicide attempt, the removal of Epstein's cellmate Efrain Reyes on August 9, 2019, failures in notification and cellmate assignment, non-functioning cameras, and other security and procedural breakdowns.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation. Discussed are his July 2019 suicide attempt, his housing, and the circumstances leading to his death on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate during the July 23, 2019 suicide attempt. The lieutenant interviewed both and found no evidence Tartaglione harmed Epstein.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was transferred out of MCC on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein without a cellmate. The lieutenant initially believed he was released from court.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The witness being interviewed. She was the SIS Lieutenant at MCC, investigated Epstein's first suicide attempt, and was involved in evidence collection after his death.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: One of the primary OIG agents conducting the interview.

persons.name: Senior Special Agent
persons.context: The second OIG agent present and participating in the interview.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The MCC captain who was notified about the non-functioning cameras on August 8 and who called the lieutenant on August 10 about Epstein's death.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.context: Was with the lieutenant on August 8 when they discovered the cameras were not recording and was notified of the issue.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: MCC psychologist who reportedly stated Epstein needed to have a cellmate after coming off suicide watch.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: Considered the Officer in Charge (OIC) in the SHU. He escorted Epstein and Reyes down on August 9 and was involved in conversations about Epstein needing a cellmate.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: SHU officer on duty on August 9. Discussed regarding responsibility for notifying about Epstein's missing cellmate.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: SHU officer on duty on August 9. Discussed regarding responsibility for notifying about Epstein's missing cellmate.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Operations lieutenant on duty the morning of August 9. Should have been notified that Reyes left and Epstein needed a new cellmate.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Evening watch operations lieutenant on August 9. Should have seen the court list and been aware Reyes left.

persons.name: SIS Tech
persons.context: The SIS technician who worked with the lieutenant. She was off on August 9 and later helped inventory Epstein's cell.

persons.name: Communications Tech
persons.context: Communications technician who checked the camera system on August 8 and said he would work overtime to fix it.

persons.name: Unit Manager
persons.context: Epstein's unit manager who provided him with an unsecured phone call on August 9, allegedly to his mother.

persons.name: NYPD Detective
persons.context: NYPD detective who called back the number Epstein dialed on August 9.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: One of the first responders to Epstein's cell on August 10.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: One of the first responders to Epstein's cell on August 10.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: A lieutenant who was among the first responders to Epstein's cell on August 10.

persons.name: R&D Supervisor
persons.context: Went to the hospital after Epstein's death to take pictures and possibly fingerprints.

connections.description: Were cellmates during Epstein's first alleged suicide attempt on July 23, 2019. Epstein stated Tartaglione did not try to harm him.
Were cellmates until Reyes was transferred out of MCC on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone.
The lieutenant investigated Epstein's first suicide attempt and had occasional check-in interactions with him.
The lieutenant reported the camera failure to the captain on August 8 and received the call from him about Epstein's death on August 10.
Were together on August 8 when they discovered the camera system was not recording.
The lieutenant notified him about the camera failure on August 8, and he said he would fix it.
Provided Epstein with an unauthorized, unsecured phone call on August 9.
Escorted Epstein and Reyes down on August 9 and was involved in a conversation about Epstein needing a cellmate.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found with a noose in his cell with cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. The SIS lieutenant investigated and found it inconclusive, though Epstein was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Camera System Failure Begins
events.description: The MCC camera system stopped recording. This was not discovered until August 8.

events.title: Cameras Discovered Not Working
events.description: The SIS lieutenant and an associate warden discovered the camera system was not recording while trying to review footage. The lieutenant notified the captain and communications tech.

events.title: Reyes Transferred, Epstein Left Without Cellmate
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes was transferred out of MCC (marked WAB - With All Belongings), leaving Jeffrey Epstein without a cellmate. Multiple staff failures occurred in notifying supervisors and assigning a new cellmate.

events.title: Epstein's Unsecured Phone Call
events.description: Epstein's unit manager provided him with an unsecured phone call in the SHU shower area, allegedly to his mother. The call was not properly monitored or logged.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his SHU cell at MCC. He was found with a noose. The lieutenant was called in and began evidence collection.

events.title: DOJ OIG Interview
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General interviews the BOP SIS lieutenant regarding the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York City
III, Brooklyn, New York 11209 (Lieutenant's home address)
keyFacts: The SIS lieutenant found Epstein's first suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, to be inconclusive, with Epstein denying self-harm and stating his cellmate did not harm him.

Epstein's cellmate Efrain Reyes was transferred out of MCC on August 9, 2019, but staff believed he went to court. Multiple staff, including officers and lieutenants, failed to notify the chain of command that Epstein was left without a required cellmate.

The MCC camera system had stopped recording on July 29, 2019, but this was not discovered until August 8. The lieutenant notified the captain and associate warden, and the communications tech said he would fix it, but it was not repaired before Epstein's death.
The lieutenant believes systematic failures—specifically the lack of proper counts/rounds and the failure to ensure Epstein had a cellmate—were key factors that allowed Epstein to take his own life.
Epstein was provided an unauthorized, unmonitored phone call on an unsecured line by his unit manager on August 9, the night before his death, which was a significant security violation.
